page.title: 06Home Life-A Child's Day.
page.content: Every Saturday morning I wake up early and I go downstairs to see Mum,who is downstairs before me every morning. I go to the lounge and let Melba, our cat,out if Mum hasn't let her out already.Then I read a book in bed and Mum brings me up a cup of tea.Next I get up and go downstairs to watch T.V. Then at nine o'clock or earlier I get dressed, have breakfast, then I play with Melba until my cousin Louise comes to spend the day with us.We ask Mum if we can go up to the fields at the end of my road and we have to come back at a certain time.We always go there on a Saturday.It was a lovely field with flowers and trees but it is wasteland, some vegetation has grown up over the barren land. There is pile of mud that has hardened.We call it the ant hill and we play around it.We always go to a hide out in the bushes.
